plugins.name: Speedy Proto
plugins.description: Create simple prototypes in one click, no matter how messy your Figma files are. Simply select multiple frames or a section containing frames, choose your animation settings and we will create a prototype in seconds. We ignore everything that is not a frame, so all your annotations, random bits of text and images will not mess up your prototype.
plugins.tagline: Lightning-fast prototypes in seconds

plugins.name: Resizer and Organizer

plugins.name: QuickToken
plugins.description:
QuickToken is the Figma plugin that enables instant variable import and seamless organization. Designed for designers who prioritize efficiency, QuickToken allows you to quickly insert variables into Figma’s local variables as design tokens. It supports collections and groups, keeping all variables clear and organized. Simplify your variable management and speed up your workflow with this powerful, efficient plugin!


Supported name schemes:


Create Variable Collection

#Collection


Create Variable Group

Group/


Create Variable

variable-name: value


The variable type recognition is automatically

based on the variable value itself.


Supported variable types


  1. Float 30
  2. Colors #333, #334455, rgb(0,100,100), rgba(2,2,2,0.1)
  3. Boolean: true, false
  4. String: 'Hello'
  5. Variable link: var(variable-name)

accepted.name: Roland Hidvegi
accepted.description: Roland Hidvegi is a Product Designer — crafting digital experiences, from vision to final touches, passionate about creating things that make people happy.

plugins.tagline: Instant variable import and organization in Figma.

plugins.name: DxH - Layer2JSON
plugins.description: DxH - Layer2JSON is a Figma plugin by Devxhub Ltd. that exports design layers (text, images, shapes) to structured JSON format. Perfect for developers looking to integrate Figma designs into apps or workflows, it supports nested layers and exports essential design properties like size, position, and styles.

plugins.name: CopyCraft
plugins.description:
Streamline your text editing workflow with a powerful tool that helps you manage and edit text content across your Figma designs with precision and ease.

How it Works:


Text Loading:

Select any frame or text element in your Figma document and load it into the editor with a single click.


Smart Organization:

  1. Texts are automatically grouped by their parent elements (Frames, Components, or Groups)
  2. Each text element shows its character count and previous versions
  3. Intuitive interface for quick access to all text elements


Efficient Editing:

  1. Edit multiple text elements simultaneously
  2. Apply text styles directly from the editor
  3. Preview changes in real-time
  4. Navigate quickly to specific elements in your design


Key Features:

  1. Character counter for precise text control
  2. Previous version tracking for each text element
  3. Direct navigation to elements in your design
  4. Batch saving capabilities for groups of text
  5. Support for text styles application


Perfect for teams working on large-scale designs where maintaining text consistency and efficiency in editing is crucial.
plugins.tagline: Text Management Made Simple

plugins.name: Import to Phase
plugins.description:
Transform your Figma designs into interactive, production-ready prototypes with Phase

• Create animations and interactions that actually ship to production

• Export as React components - no more design-to-code translation issues (Beta Release)

• Enable multiple simultaneous interactions (impossible in Figma alone)

• Work seamlessly between Figma and Phase with automatically organized interactions

• Professional animation tools: keyframes, motion paths, easing curves, and animation presets

• Real-time collaboration with developers and stakeholders


Join thousands of designers who bridge the gap between design and development! 🚀


Getting started is incredibly simple:

1 Select your design - Choose frames, components, or groups to export

2 Click Import - Phase allows you to choose to turn your variants into interactions (Please note that nested components are not yet supported due to Figma's flattened component system, but we're working on it! :-)

3 Open in Phase - Your designs are ready with interactions converted to Actions

4 Enhance & Export - Add animations and export as code or media files


Check our documentation for detailed guides and tutorials.


Documentation

• Quick Start Guide

• Interactions

• Video Tutorials


Features

🎯 Design to Code, Seamlessly

Unlike other prototyping tools, Phase exports your animations and interactions as production-ready React components. What you design is what gets built.

⚡ Multiple Simultaneous Interactions

Break free from Figma's limitations. Run multiple animations and interactions at the same time - just like in real applications.

🎨 Professional Animation Control

• Keyframes - Precise control over every animation property

• Path Animations - Motion paths for curved movements, trim paths for draw-on effects, and path morphing for shape transformations

• Animation Presets - ready-to-use animation effects (fade, scale, spin, trim, and more)

• Advanced Easing - Bezier curves, elastic, bounce, and custom easing


🔄 Import your Figma Interactions

You can choose to convert your Interactive components from Figma to Phase Actions.

🚀 Export Options That Matter

• React Components - Production-ready code

• Lottie - Lightweight animations for web and mobile

• Video/GIF - For presentations and social media

• dotLottie - Compressed animations with smaller file sizes


👥 Built for Teams

• Real-time collaboration with multi-cursor support

• Version history and commenting

• Share prototypes with stakeholders instantly


What makes Phase different?

From Design to Development

While other tools stop at visual prototypes, Phase generates actual code. Your beautiful interactions become real features, not just demos.

True Interactivity

Create conditional logic, decision-based flows, and complex user journeys. Phase combines visual design with programming logic.

Developer-Friendly

No more "lost in translation" between design and development. Developers receive clean, organized React components they can actually use.


Current Limitations

We believe in transparency. Here's what to expect:

• Borders become centered in Phase

• Text underlines and emojis aren't supported yet

• Blur/shadow effects may appear differently

• Polygons convert to paths

• Code export doesn’t support booleans and some animations yet because translating the canvas into code is really hard.. we’re working on it and shipping fast!

•We can’t yet support importing nested components because Figma’s flattened design system is not compatible, we’re figuring out a workaround!


These limitations are temporary as we continuously improve the plugin.


FAQ

Can I use Phase without coding knowledge?

  1. Absolutely! Phase is designed for designers. The code export is a bonus for developer handoff, but you never need to write code yourself.

What happens to my Figma interactions?

  1. They're automatically converted to Phase Actions, ready for enhancement with advanced animations.

Can I collaborate with my team?

  1. Yes! Phase supports real-time collaboration, commenting, and version history. Share via restricted links, remix links, or prototype-only links.

What export formats are supported?

• Code: React components with CSS & JavaScript (Beta Release)

• Animation: GIF, MP4, Lottie (.json), dotLottie (.lottie)

• All exports maintain your animation timing and interactions

Is it free to try?

  1. Yes! Phase is free to use.


We're here to help you succeed:

📧 Email: support@phase.com

💬 Community: Join our community: https://community.phase.com/c/questions/


⠀

Ready to ship real interactions? Install Import to Phase and bridge the gap between design and development today! ✨
plugins.tagline: Design in Figma, Prototype in Phase

plugins.name: Pseudo Localizer for Figma & FigJam
plugins.description:
Design global-ready UIs—without ever leaving Figma.


Skip the guesswork and see how your designs hold up in other languages, scripts, and text directions—instantly. With Pseudo Localizer, you can preview localized versions of your UI in seconds, directly inside Figma or FigJam. No setup, no logins, no external tools. Just you and your design.


ℹ️ What you can do with Pseudo Localizer:


✅ Preview global scripts instantly

Toggle between Latin, Cyrillic, CJK, and Arabic (RTL) with a single click.


✅ Test layout resilience

Stretch or shrink text length from –50% to +50% to spot issues like clipping, wrapping, or misalignment.


✅ Control the scope

Run it on a single button, a card, or the whole page—your call.


✅ Keep it private & fast

Everything happens on your machine. No accounts, no external servers, no privacy worries.


❗️Why it matters:


  1. Catch layout issues before they become bugs.
  2. Give your QA and localization teams better previews.
  3. Design smarter for a global audience—right from the start.


⚙️ How it works:


  1. Select your screens with text layers (or don't select anything to pseudo translate the full page).
  2. Pick your script and text expansion.
  3. Click "Pseudotranslate"—done! A new page appears with your mocked-up, localized content (including RTL adjustments).


✨ Ready to build for every language?

Install Pseudo Localizer from the Figma Community and see how your designs hold up across the globe.


📨 Got feedback? Share it here!

accepted.name: José Jóvena Casañ
accepted.description:
Helping teams make great design work everywhere.
Big on UX, localization, and making things clear across cultures.
Rookie Figma Plugin Author.

plugins.tagline: Instantly pseudotranslate your Figma designs to test global layouts—no setup, no accounts.

plugins.name: Text & Color to CSS Variables
plugins.description:
This plugin helps you generate clean, reusable CSS variables from selected Figma layers.

It supports both text styles and fill colors, and automatically converts them into:


@mixin snippets for font styles


:root CSS variables for color values (in HEX format)


Auto-detects color types like color-gray, color-blue, color-red, etc.


Prevents name duplication with numbered suffixes (e.g., --color-gray-1, --color-gray-2)


Sorts all variables in ascending order for better readability


Perfect for building design systems or exporting ready-to-use CSS from design files.
plugins.tagline: Extract text styles and fill colors from Figma layers and convert them into organized CSS variables.

131055.name: Text & Color to CSS Variables
131055.description:
This plugin helps you generate clean, reusable CSS variables from selected Figma layers.

It supports both text styles and fill colors, and automatically converts them into:


@mixin snippets for font styles


:root CSS variables for color values (in HEX format)


Auto-detects color types like color-gray, color-blue, color-red, etc.


Prevents name duplication with numbered suffixes (e.g., --color-gray-1, --color-gray-2)


Sorts all variables in ascending order for better readability


Perfect for building design systems or exporting ready-to-use CSS from design files.
131055.tagline: Extract text styles and fill colors from Figma layers and convert them into organized CSS variables.

plugins.name: Easy Task Prioritiser
plugins.description:
Easy Task Prioritiser Quickly organize and rank your tasks using two proven prioritization frameworks — right inside Figma.


✨ How It Works

🔢 Stack Ranking

Go to the Stack tab.

Enter your list of tasks.

Click Start Comparison to begin.

You’ll be shown two tasks at a time — choose which is more important.

Repeat until all tasks are compared and ranked.

In the end:

You'll get a clear, ranked list of tasks

You can Copy to Clipboard or Push to Canvas to bring the list into your Figma file


🧠 MoSCoW Prioritization

Switch to the MoSCoW tab.

Add your tasks.

For each task, select whether it’s a Must, Should, Could, or Won’t.

Once done, use Push to Canvas to generate a structured visual layout by category.

In the end:

You can Copy to Clipboard or Push to Canvas to see tasks grouped by priority


This plugin is perfect for product teams, designers, and facilitators who want to make prioritization decisions quickly — and stay focused on what matters most.
plugins.tagline: Turn messy task lists into clear priorities.

plugins.name: Screenshot to 100%
plugins.description:
The plugin quickly scales selected images to 100% of their real screenshot size in one click.


On Windows, if your display scaling (for example, 175%) is set above 100%, screenshots are captured at a larger size and look incorrect when pasted into Figma. This plugin helps you downscale screenshots so they appear correctly in Figma.


To use the plugin properly, set the same scale value in the plugin settings as in your Windows display settings.

accepted.name: Nik M
accepted.description: UX/UI/Product designer with more than 10+ years exp.

plugins.tagline: The plugin quickly scales selected images to 100% of their real screenshot size in one click.

129333.name: Screenshot to 100%
129333.description:

On Windows, if your display scaling (for example, 175%) is set above 100%, screenshots are captured at a larger size and look incorrect when pasted into Figma. This plugin helps you downscale screenshots so they appear correctly in Figma.


To use the plugin properly, set the same scale value in the plugin settings as in your Windows display settings.
129333.tagline: The plugin quickly scales selected images to 100% of their real screenshot size in one click.

plugins.name: FileDetox
plugins.description: FileDetox is a powerful Figma cleanup tool that hunts down and eliminates the hidden clutter slowing down your design files. With its distinctive neo-brutalist interface, FileDetox quickly identifies hidden layers, empty frames, unused styles, and off-canvas elements that contribute to file bloat. In just a few clicks, purge unnecessary elements and optimize your workflow. Design with intention, not with digital baggage. Made by gautham.
plugins.tagline: Design Detoxification. Simplified.

plugins.name: Find & Replace Anything
plugins.description:
Search for anything on your page and replace it with anything you want!


A powerful tool for finding and replacing styles! Works with components, instances and library styles. Especially helpful to align parameters across projects in bulk like auto layout or library styles for your pixel perfect design.


Plugin is in active development. Therefore, any feedback is appreciated! Like our plugin? Leave a heart!


Full feature list:


Library & local Styles

  1. Fonts
  2. Colors
  3. Effects
  4. Grids


Variables (search only)

  1. Color Variable
  2. Number Variable
  3. String Variable
  4. Boolean Variable


Shape & Frame

  1. Name
  2. Width
  3. Height
  4. Position X
  5. Position Y
  6. Rotation
  7. Constrain Proportions
  8. Clip content


Text

  1. Text
  2. Font Size
  3. Paragraphs Spacing
  4. Paragraph Indent
  5. Text Decoration
  6. Text Case
  7. Text Resizing
  8. Text Align Horizontal
  9. Text Align Vertical


Layer

  1. Blend Mode
  2. Opacity
  3. Visibility


Stroke

  1. Stroke Align
  2. Stroke Weight
  3. Stroke Join


Auto Layout

  1. Layout mode
  2. Spacing between items
  3. Paddings
plugins.tagline: Search for anything on your page and replace it with anything you want!

plugins.name: Mode Match
plugins.description:
Mode Match lets you take a variable's value from one mode and apply it to other modes. Match a single variable, group of variables, or all variables in a collection!


  1. Select your multi-mode collection
  2. Select the source mode (copy from)
  3. Select the destination mode (copy to)
  4. Enter the path to a group of variables or a single variable (see below for bulk actions)
  5. Update ✨


Tip

  1. Keep your variable window open to see the changes.
  2. Use the Refresh button to pull in changes to the variables made when the plugin window is open. (see below for copy & paste)
  3. Use clear to quickly delete the path.


Bulk Actions

You will most likely want to run this on a group or the entire collection:

  1. Update all variables within a group by entering a path/to/group
  2. Update all variables in the collection by entering / @all or @root in the path input


Plugin Notes

  1. Collection list will only show collections with more than 1 mode
  2. Variable names and paths are case sensitive
  3. Updating variables, especially those linked to text styles may take longer to propagate


Supports

  1. All variable types (number, string, boolean, color)
  2. Aliasing
  3. Raw values


Copy/Paste Figma Bug

If you copy/paste variables between collections, you may need to reload the tab in order for those variables to register in their new collection.

accepted.name: Murph
accepted.description: Systems Designer • Plugin Author • Rectangle Lover

plugins.tagline: Match variable values across modes.

plugins.name: MoveQuack
plugins.description:
Feature Overview

This plugin allows users to set customizable timers for both work and break periods, catering to individual needs.


Key Features

Customizable Timer: Set specific times for work and rest, with full flexibility.

Timed Reminders: Automatically alerts users when it's time to take a break, preventing overwork.

Boost Efficiency and Health: Helps maintain high productivity while ensuring overall well-being.


Use Cases

Perfect for users who engage in long work or study sessions, especially for professionals like designers and developers who need regular breaks.
plugins.tagline: Break Reminder Timer

plugins.name: Synchronize Frames
plugins.description:
This program enhances efficiency in Figma by allowing users to synchronize frames automatically. It ensures that any modifications made to a selected frame are instantly reflected in all corresponding frames, promoting consistency across designs. The user interface features intuitive buttons to assign frames, toggle synchronization, and activate auto-sync capabilities.


To automatically search for frames for synchronization, the "SS_" tag must be specified before the frame name.
plugins.tagline: Seamlessly synchronize your design frames for a more efficient workflow

It ensures that any modifications made to a selected frame are instantly reflected in all corresponding frames, promoting consistency across designs. The user interface features intuitive buttons to assign frames, toggle synchronization, and activate auto-sync capabilities.


To automatically search for frames for synchronization, the "SS_" tag must be specified before the frame name.

plugins.name: snapInsert
plugins.description:
snapInsert is a powerful Figma plugin designed to streamline the process of searching filtering and adding component instances into your designs.

Perfect for designers and teams who work with large design systems, Component Filter helps you save time and maintain focus on your design tasks.


Key Features:

• Component Set Filtering: Easily filter components by their set names to focus on specific groups within your design system.

• Dynamic Key-Value Filtering: Use key-value pairs to narrow down your search and find exactly what you need based on component properties like size, orientation, or any custom attributes.

• Real-Time Results: As you apply filters, see immediate updates to the component list, ensuring you always have the most relevant components in view.

• Intuitive UI: The plugin features a clean, user-friendly interface that integrates seamlessly with Figma, making it easy to apply filters and manage your components.


Note:

Currently, Component Filter only searches for components within the file you are working on. In future releases, users will be able to search components from published design libraries, expanding the plugin's functionality to cover broader design systems.
plugins.tagline: Effortlessly search and insert component instances from sets or singles into your designs.

• Dynamic Key-Value Filtering: Use key-value pairs to narrow down your search and find exactly what you need based on component properties like size, orientation, or any custom attributes.

• Real-Time Results: As you apply filters, see immediate updates to the component list, ensuring you always have the most relevant components in view.

• Intuitive UI: The plugin features a clean, user-friendly interface that integrates seamlessly with Figma, making it easy to apply filters and manage your components.


Note:

plugins.name: Corners Alignment
plugins.description:
主要功能


1. 对齐多个选定矩形的相对圆角

当您选中两个或多个矩形 (Rectangle) 时，插件会：

自动识别选区中尺寸最大的矩形作为“外部参考矩形”。

调整其他较小矩形的圆角，使其圆角弧度与最大矩形的圆角弧度在视觉上保持与它们之间边距相等的空间感。

如果矩形不是按比例居中对齐，则会使用它们之间的最小边距作为计算依据。


2. 对齐容器内元素的圆角（选中容器时）

当您选中一个画框 (Frame) 或启用了自动布局 (Auto Layout)、组件 (Component) 或实例 (Instance) 时，插件会：

将其视为“外部容器”。

调整该容器内部所有符合条件的【第一层】子元素（如矩形、其他画框等）的圆角。


Main Features


1. Aligning the Relative Corner Radii of Multiple Selected Rectangles

When you select two or more rectangles (Rectangle), the plugin will:

- Automatically identify the largest rectangle in the selection as the "outer reference rectangle."

- Adjust the corner radii of the smaller rectangles so that their curvature visually maintains a sense of spacing equal to the margins between them and the largest rectangle.

- If the rectangles are not proportionally center-aligned, the smallest margin between them will be used as the basis for calculation.


2. Aligning the Corner Radii of Elements Within a Container (When Selecting a Container)

When you select a frame (Frame), or an auto-layout-enabled component (Component) or instance (Instance), the plugin will:

- Treat it as an "outer container."

- Adjust the corner radii of all eligible **first-level** child elements (such as rectangles, other frames, etc.) inside the container.
plugins.tagline: 对齐嵌套圆角 Align nested corners

136753.name: Corners Alignment
136753.description:
主要功能


1. 对齐多个选定矩形的相对圆角

当您选中两个或多个矩形 (Rectangle) 时，插件会：

自动识别选区中尺寸最大的矩形作为“外部参考矩形”。

调整其他较小矩形的圆角，使其圆角弧度与最大矩形的圆角弧度在视觉上保持与它们之间边距相等的空间感。

如果矩形不是按比例居中对齐，则会使用它们之间的最小边距作为计算依据。


2. 对齐容器内元素的圆角（选中容器时）

当您选中一个画框 (Frame) 或启用了自动布局 (Auto Layout)、组件 (Component) 或实例 (Instance) 时，插件会：

将其视为“外部容器”。

调整该容器内部所有符合条件的【第一层】子元素（如矩形、其他画框等）的圆角。


Main Features


1. Aligning the Relative Corner Radii of Multiple Selected Rectangles

When you select two or more rectangles (Rectangle), the plugin will:

- Automatically identify the largest rectangle in the selection as the "outer reference rectangle."

- Adjust the corner radii of the smaller rectangles so that their curvature visually maintains a sense of spacing equal to the margins between them and the largest rectangle.

- If the rectangles are not proportionally center-aligned, the smallest margin between them will be used as the basis for calculation.


2. Aligning the Corner Radii of Elements Within a Container (When Selecting a Container)

When you select a frame (Frame), or an auto-layout-enabled component (Component) or instance (Instance), the plugin will:

- Treat it as an "outer container."

- Adjust the corner radii of all eligible **first-level** child elements (such as rectangles, other frames, etc.) inside the container.
136753.release_notes:
增加了ui界面，新增了最小圆角值和平滑圆角值设置，新增了邻近角对齐模式(适用于九宫格之类的网格自动布局)。
Added UI interface, added minimum corner radius and smooth corner radius settings, added adjacent corner alignment mode (suitable for grid automatic layouts such as 3x3 grids).
136753.tagline: 对齐嵌套圆角 Align nested corners

135674.tagline: Select a shape or frame to generate the color specs

plugins.name: Auto Layout Remover
plugins.description:
Auto Layout Remover helps you quickly clean up messy Figma files and make them easier to edit or prototype.


When to use it:

  1. You want to redesign freely. If your design is full of auto layouts and deeply nested frames, and you just want to move things around without dealing with layout constraints — this plugin flattens everything so you can edit with ease.
  2. You’re building an interactive prototype. Auto layouts often create layers and nesting that block or overlap each other. This plugin helps you clean the structure fast — so you can bring the right blocks to the top and avoid layout issues.


What it does:

  1. Turns off all auto layouts, keeping objects in place
  2. Ungroups frames and groups without visible styles (no fill, no stroke, or hidden)
  3. Deletes hidden layers and empty frames
  4. Leaves instances and styled frames untouched
  5. Makes your file flat, clean, and easy to work with
plugins.tagline: Remove all auto layouts, empty frames, and groups in one click.

134108.name: Auto Layout Remover
134108.description:
Auto Layout Remover helps you quickly clean up messy Figma files and make them easier to edit or prototype.


When to use it:

  1. You want to redesign freely. If your design is full of auto layouts and deeply nested frames, and you just want to move things around without dealing with layout constraints — this plugin flattens everything so you can edit with ease.
  2. You’re building an interactive prototype. Auto layouts often create layers and nesting that block or overlap each other. This plugin helps you clean the structure fast — so you can bring the right blocks to the top and avoid layout issues.


What it does:

  1. Turns off all auto layouts, keeping objects in place
  2. Ungroups frames and groups without visible styles (no fill, no stroke, or hidden)
  3. Deletes hidden layers and empty frames
  4. Leaves instances and styled frames untouched
  5. Makes your file flat, clean, and easy to work with
134108.tagline: Remove all auto layouts, empty frames, and groups in one click.

plugins.name: FigJsonizer
plugins.description:
This plugin lets you select any frame or component in Figma and instantly convert it into a clean, structured JSON object. It's perfect for devs building UI components, syncing data with code, or generating design specs.


No network needed, no fluff—just fast, reliable JSON export from your Figma canvas. Copy the data to clipboard and use it wherever your workflow takes you: React, Angular, JSON-based APIs—you name it.


Ideal for design-to-dev handoff, prototyping, and frontend engineering.
plugins.tagline: Generate and copy clean JSON from selected Figma frames.

133815.name: FigJsonizer
133815.description:
This plugin lets you select any frame or component in Figma and instantly convert it into a clean, structured JSON object. It's perfect for devs building UI components, syncing data with code, or generating design specs.


No network needed, no fluff—just fast, reliable JSON export from your Figma canvas. Copy the data to clipboard and use it wherever your workflow takes you: React, Angular, JSON-based APIs—you name it.


Ideal for design-to-dev handoff, prototyping, and frontend engineering.
133815.tagline: Generate and copy clean JSON from selected Figma frames.

plugins.name: XRechnung XML Export
plugins.description: This plugin lets you export a ready-to-send XRechnung XML invoice from a structured Figma template (https://www.figma.com/community/file/1506387895617421047/xrechnung-invoice-template-for-freelancers-germany). It's built for freelancers and creatives working with German public-sector clients who need to submit invoices via portals like ZRE, OZG-RE, or PEPPOL. Just fill in the provided template, select the invoice frame, and run the plugin. It creates a valid .xml file with one click—no coding or formatting required.
plugins.tagline: Generate valid XRechnung XML invoices directly from Figma.

136943.name: XRechnung XML Export
136943.description: This plugin lets you export a ready-to-send XRechnung XML invoice from a structured Figma template (https://www.figma.com/community/file/1506387895617421047/xrechnung-invoice-template-for-freelancers-germany). It's built for freelancers and creatives working with German public-sector clients who need to submit invoices via portals like ZRE, OZG-RE, or PEPPOL. Just fill in the provided template, select the invoice frame, and run the plugin. It creates a valid .xml file with one click—no coding or formatting required.
136943.tagline: Generate valid XRechnung XML invoices directly from Figma.

plugins.name: Palettano - Color Palette Library
plugins.description:
🎨✨ Description with Emojis:

Palettano is your ultimate 🎯 design companion for color 🎨 perfection!

Explore a curated library of 500+ beautiful color palettes 🌈, ready to inspire your next project 💡.


🔍 Search palettes by mood, theme, or keyword

🖥️ Test palettes on real UI layouts before committing

📐 Preview colors in buttons, cards, backgrounds & more

🎯 Stay consistent with your brand or product design

⚡ Fast, smooth, and intuitive—built for creative minds!


Whether you're a designer 👩‍🎨, developer 👨‍💻, or color enthusiast 🎉, Palettano makes picking the perfect palette effortless and fun 🚀.
plugins.tagline: Access 500+ curated palettes and preview them live—design consistent, colorful interfaces
